channel.title: Java flash player?
channel.description: Does anyone know how to put a flash movie/ game in a JFrame? if u did, it would help! thanks

I wouldn’t call it enslave…maybe closer to…umm… capture you and then force you to work for me? Two completely different things

item.title: Java flash player?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:4, topic:25058”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=37826.msg456627#msg456627 date=1163487493]
You could load a webpage containing flash in a JFrame, thats most likely not what you want though…
[/quote]
You can’t. I’m pretty sure that the HTML parser + executor in swing doesn’t support Flash (or most javascript, or even java applets).[/quote]

I was reffering more to jdic, which would work

Read full topic

item.title: Java flash player?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

moparisthebest:

You could load a webpage containing flash in a JFrame, thats most likely not what you want though…

You can’t. I’m pretty sure that the HTML parser + executor in swing doesn’t support Flash (or most javascript, or even java applets).

Read full topic

item.title: Java flash player?
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

The only way to truly load a swf into a java component is to create a com bridge and implement the interface provided in the active x control. There are some solutions you can look into to generate the classes needed to implement the java portion of the control.

[ul][li]ComfyJ from the makers of JNIWrapper - fantastic[/li]
[li]njawin - sub project of jawin… google it.[/li][/ul]

You should be able to find a code generator in the distributions. If you have any other issues, refer to my signature.

Read full topic
